website_summaries.verdict: Although these 10 mice don't have any fancy features, the pack is a good value for felines who love playtime and catnip.
pros: Pack of 10 soft toy mice for a decent price
Catnip is potent enough to attract most cats quickly
The size of each mouse makes it easy for cats to carry, bat, and pounce on them
cons: Aggressive play can result in rips, causing the foam stuffing to fall out
Cats can chew the tails off
Occasionally cats don't care for them

customer_reviews.title: I wrapped these up and put them under my tree ...
customer_reviews.text: I wrapped these up and put them under my tree for my cat, Dracula. The same day, I heard a noise, and he was under the tree, unwrapping his mice with his teeth haha. He ended up getting them out, and ripping them out of the package haha. He loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Carissa Thrush

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves them. He prefers these mouse toys a lot more than other brands I've tried. I think it's because these are more the size of real mice, and they're plushy. He can easily carry them around in his mouth. The only caveat is that as any cat owner knows, what one cat loves, another cat may refuse to even look at. I like them because they're well made. They hold up to a lot of abuse. Every once in a while, I see a little pink felt ear on the floor, but otherwise, none have torn, nor have the tails and eyes come off nor has my cat been able to bite them off.
customer_reviews.author: Jemma

customer_reviews.title: Can't keep enough of these in my house.
customer_reviews.text: My two kitties chase these, throw them in the air, and generally have a ball, losing many under furniture and in closets. Pacino does her cat version of fetch by meowing like crazy while bringing one of them to me and waiting for me to throw it, which I do. She always runs to it, sometimes just to sniff, leaving it, but she always runs back to me, with or without the mouse. I give her lots of love, telling her what a good girl she is, thus ends fetch till the next time. Cherokee and Pacino are ten year old brother and sister. It's so nice to see them running and jumping, having fun at their age.
customer_reviews.author: Little Duggies

customer_reviews.title: Our Cat Was High within Minutes
customer_reviews.text: Our cat instantly started playing with the first mouse I tossed her. I left her alone for a few minutes and came back to this scene.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D

customer_reviews.title: Lazy Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats - a very energetic siamese cat (Loki) and less active older cat (Cyd) and they both love these catnip mice toys. They toys are very light weight I really like that they are not made from fur. Loki destroys real and fake fur toy mice by skinning them and ripping of their tails. It was super creepy finding skinned cat toys on my pillow. The tail is made from some sort of twine that neither cat has managed to rip off and the cloth body of the mice is very durable. These things get lost under furniture before my cats manage to destroy them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley J Duff

customer_reviews.title: Hazardous Tails.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with these. I bought a pack of them for my kitten because she loves these kinds of toys and I caught her eating the tail off of one. I threw them out. I don't want her playing with toys that can cause her to ingest something that will hurt her. The tails are very poor and easy for a cat to chew off and swallow. If you but these be sure to keep an eye on your cat when they are playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Call Me Cat

customer_reviews.title: BAD SmartyKat. DO NOT buy this toy
customer_reviews.text: warning! this is not a safe cat toy. poorly made and to my shock had a plastic bag inside each one! BAD SmartyKat. DO NOT buy this toy.My kittens each had one for less then 2 minutes and they were ripped in half and the plastic bags could of been choked on, if I had not been there. Trash! See picture.
customer_reviews.author: Sequoia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Natasha’s favorite
customer_reviews.text: Natasha loves these little mice. She fetches them when you throw them. She puts them in my bed, shoes, purse, and in my lap when I’m watching tv. She even tries to feed them by dropping them in food.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Maria

customer_reviews.title: two happy cats
customer_reviews.text: I knew my little nip head would love these. She was all over me the moment the package arrived. My male kitty is normally indifferent to catnip and has never been thrilled with mouse toys but he loves these too. They each claimed their own mouse, and ignore the toy if it's not the chosen mouse, which I've never seen them do. These have been pounced, batted, clawed, slobbered on, rolled on, and carried around the house. I found one hidden under my pillow last night, a certain feline seal of approval.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie MayTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: They look differently
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves them. The only thing is that they don't look exactly as on the picture.
customer_reviews.author: A. D.

customer_reviews.title: My cat’s new favorite toy. My new worse nightmare
customer_reviews.text: My cat’s new favorite toy. My new worse nightmare. She loves it so much I’ve been woken up multiple times to her punting the thing across the room and body slamming into walls chasing it. I should say SHE gives it 5 stars. I’m teally torn. I love that she loves it but I had a much quieter house before she had such a fantastic toy. It really is true the simplist things can really be the best. From my feline to you- your cat will probably enjoy this.
customer_reviews.author: robyn p

customer_reviews.title: 80% loved it
customer_reviews.text: Four of the five cats loved this. Even my very snooty older Siamese got high and silly. They rubbed their faces against it, held it in their paws and licked it, rolled it all over the floor and then went to their caves and beds to sleep it off. I made one mistake, though, so am warning anyone with cats who love it . . . Put it away at night! Otherwise they will have a bowling tournament in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Simple little cat toy, nothing fancy but, well liked.
customer_reviews.text: For all the fancy cat toys I’ve bought, I still see my cats and their foster siblings (of which they’ve had many) carrying around the little, inexpensive stuff mice toys in their mouths and tossing them up in the air. Over the years, several had been lost so I bought this pack to restock. My cats (fosters included) all like them. They carry them around in theirs mouths like it’s a recent kill.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Cat's favorite
customer_reviews.text: These mice are my 5-year-old cat's favorite toys. He will kick them around, fetch them, and hunt them like prey. They do not have any jingling or crinkling inside of them, but they are his favorite nonetheless. And they say there is cat nip in them, but I cannot smell it nor have I seen it. Cat still loves them. The only problem I find is that eventually he will chew off the tails, so once I see that he has started to gnaw on the tails, I cut them off so he does not eat them. He will also eventually chew through them until the stuffing comes out. They are affordable so at that point I just replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My extremely high energy cat loves these - some of them end up splitting at the seams, but he gets enough play out of them that I don't mind buying them in packs like this. The catnip seems powerful enough on its own, you won't have to rub any extra on to get them interested, and they skitter and slide and bounce along floors very well. They are a bit easy to lose, and that accounts for most of mine rather than them falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: They keep disappearing!
customer_reviews.text: My cat just loves soft stuffed toys! They're the only type of toy she's ever shown any interest in (although catnip has no appeal for her). There are only 2 problems. One is that they are too narrow, so they keep disappearing under appliances (fridge? oven?) The other is the color. They are so neutral, they blend in with rugs/carpets. I don't know about all cats, but mine doesn't seem to be able to notice her mousy if it's the same color as the rug. Wish they came in bright colors! Great for the price. Kinda glad I was forced to buy 2 packs, considering how fast she's going through them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gold

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: Got for two adult cats who love catnip. One of the three broke within an hour. I think part of the problem is the way the plastic stem was attached to the cardboard backing. Once that plastic tag is cut off it is too far inside the toy to get it out easily. I was concerned my cats would choke on that plastic so I spent a long time getting every little piece of it out. Now I have to be concerned that they would choke on the stuffing.
customer_reviews.author: bkwrm

customer_reviews.title: Best cat toy
customer_reviews.text: If I could give more than 5 stars I would. My cats are obsessed with this catnip ball! Most catnip toys need to be refilled at one point or another, but since this is made of catnip, you don't have to refill it. Eventually, it gets old and needs to be replaced, but for the price, it is worth every penny. I usually replace mine every 6 months. My cats come running when they hear me toss it across the floor and they just love it. It can be loud if you have hardwood floors, but it doesn't bother me. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SoxBeerFish

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love this -- my brother's cat...not so much
customer_reviews.text: Our cats got this as a Christmas gift and love it. We call it Cracker Rat (because it reminds me of the mouse from The Nutcracker story). I never even put the catnip in and they still love it. One of our cats tries to groom it. I think our female cat mostly plays with this as time goes on. She usually leaves it as a gift at our bedroom door sometime during the night. I then bought this toy on Amazon to give to my brother's cat, thinking it would love it as well. Last I heard, the cat was not playing with it. Cats are goofy that way. Not every cat likes the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: MamaKitty

customer_reviews.title: Hard, Compressed Catnip.
customer_reviews.text: My cats follow me from room to room so they were observing my amazon package opening. I hate packaging engineers and this one is amazingly secure. As soon as I made a tiny cut, they could smell the catnip and were frantic to have it! I had to really work to get it free then four cats wanted it. It was kind of like a soccer game as they grabbed and batted at it rolling it all around the room. They lick it and roll on it and get sillier and sillier. It's very hard. Apparently tightly compressed. I'll have to let you know later how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kenworthy

customer_reviews.title: Riley Cat Love Them
customer_reviews.text: Being shut in the home can take a toll on us. But being shut in the home with a 16 pound Maine Coon Cat that wants to lap sit 24/7 really takes a toll! So it was time to stock up on cat toys and these did the trick. He immediately threw them around the house for over 30 minutes and wore himself out enough that he headed off to the spare bedroom to crash on the bed for a 2-hour nap! He absolutely loves these mice and this order gives the wife and me some alone time w/o the cat joining us on the couch.
customer_reviews.author: George Francis

customer_reviews.title: Danger - My cat was eating the insides in less than 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: While the catnip smell did make my cat go berserk for these, the material they are made of is not very durable at all. In less than 30 minutes, my cat had a large hole in one of them and was basically chewing on the catnip laced stuffing. I'm super glad I was put these out at a time when I was definitely around for a while. I can't even imagine how things might have gone if he'd actually ingested all of that stuffing.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: WOW Old Cat Loves It
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen my cat react like this to any toy. Immediately after opening the package he was watching the toy. The second I put it by him he was ready to go. Chasing it all over my room, rubbing his face against it. He adores these things, I have hidden them all around for him to hunt and play with. He's almost 16 so to see this kind of energy from him was astounding. 10/10 would recommend EDIT: Tied one of these little mice onto a string and a stick and HOLY CRAP. I have NEVER seen my cat this willing to play. He LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: All four cats love these toys!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect toy for cats! The catnip stuffed toys don't usually interest all four cats, but they are 4 for 4 on loving these. It is a great way for them to enjoy catnip without all the mess. That is until the chew them up..
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: My feline overlord LOVES these. I got her the big mouse version but she scoffed and rebuffed any attempts at pleasing her with it. She prefers to chase these small ones and bunny kicks them up and down the stairs. She doesn't seem to tire of them even though she plays with them everyday. They start to get soft and will lose an eye so having multiples is great. I can replace the dying ones with a fresh one and that makes the mistress a happy feline indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Shoegal

customer_reviews.title: Mice mice everywhere
customer_reviews.text: This is "the" favorite toy according to my cats . This is my second purchase of Skitter Mice, because one of my cats has taken to hiding & hording them instead of sharing with the other cats. I don't know if it's the dribble of cat nip within or the fact that the tail is hardened, slightly knobby string, adding to the fun of grasping & flinging it into the air, but my cats will root around in the shoe box I keep their toys in looking specifically for one of these mice. What I like about them is that they are cheap, don't fall apart, & if you accidentally step on one they're soft.
customer_reviews.author: GleepKitty

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved, encourages play
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these "madcap" mice. They're one of his favorite toys. The size is just right; he likes to carry it around in his mouth and flip it up in the air. Big enough he feels like he's got a prize, but small enough to toss around easily. The catnip pouch inside is a nice touch to encourage play and activity. My cat has gone through three of these in about two years, playing with them to the point of tearing them open. That shows how popular they are.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M

customer_reviews.title: Kitty LOVES these.
customer_reviews.text: OMG... I have one kitty that is absolutely bonkers over these things. She carries them around the house, prrrt-ing to let me know she has a treasure. I don't know where she puts them, and currently there a three in the house I can't find, but sure enough, SHE knows where they are because she'll show up with one out of the blue. prrrt prrrt I tried other 'mice' but she wasn't as fond of those as she was of these.
customer_reviews.author: SusieG

customer_reviews.title: they were nothing like the picture
customer_reviews.text: The picture of this mouse is what I wanted. My cat got one when he was a kitten and loves the heck out of it. It is worn to shreds. I wanted to buy a replacement, in fact I ordered four. Two for me and two for a friend. When I got the four, they were nothing like the picture. They had very long hair, and were ugly colors. Brownish and whiteish. I called Amazon to return them. Not happy, as they were not what was pictured.
customer_reviews.author: The phantom

customer_reviews.title: Not a hit with my cats
customer_reviews.text: We have an older cat, and just recently adopted a kitten and I have been buying new cat toys for them like crazy to help aid in their play and activity. Though these fish toys were very affordable which was nice, they just weren’t a hit with my cats. My kitten who loves almost all toys went and sniffed one of these toys once and they haven’t been touched since. They have just been gathering dust since we got them, they just don’t have enough catnip in them and aren’t as exciting for my cats as I thought they would be and ultimately were a dud.
customer_reviews.author: skellimae

customer_reviews.title: Furry!
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to figure out where the catnip goes in, the Velcro was hidden in the fur pretty well! The fur also gets caught up in the Velcro making it a little tricky to reseal after adding catnip. Overall not bad for the price. My cat loved it for about 10 minutes and has barely touched it since, despite me refilling it several times but she's just picky I guess. Catnip lasts several refills! It still looks like I've barely used any after at least 4 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them
customer_reviews.text: So, I had to hide these in a drawer until Christmas day. I bought three, one for each of my cats. My cats were after them as soon as I took them out of the Amazon box. I wrapped the mice and put them under the tree Christmas evening. My cat toothless, was first. He went to town playing and unwrapping his package. It was fun to watch each of them unwrap them. They love them.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Cats adore these
customer_reviews.text: Evidently 50 to 70% of cats respond to catnip. I've only had cats who ignored the stuff before, buying toys and trying to grow it in vain. Imagine my delight when I tried out our new additions, a mother and daughter, on these little toys and found them turning into drunken cats, literally rolling on top of them in ecstasy. Even now, they will fetch these little mice and carry them around the house like dogs with a ball, looking for someone to play with them. For such a tiny little purchase, they were a much bigger hit than many cat toys!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Ann Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great cat toys
customer_reviews.text: Just got 4 cards of these mice and my cats love them. They even fought over the Amazon box they were shipped in. Powerful catnip toys they will play with for quite a while. Glad I purchased 4 cards. My oldest cat like to put his favorite toys in the toilet and then closes the lid so they’re safe. I know I will find these toys in there so will have to remind everyone to keep the lid down. I’m sure he feels they’re in there for safe keeping. Buy these mice, they are well worth it!! I’m sure I will be back for more.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Griffith

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these little mice.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 packs of these because of the add on price. they are small about 1 1\2 inches big. Basically no bigger than your thump. But,... My 4 year old cat just loves play time with these mice. I bought a pack a few weeks ago & she couldn't get enough of these. She tore them open & I sewed them back closed. It's not that these are cheaply made but she loves pulling things apart & her favorite toys is no exception. So I have bought more to keep on hand. They really entertain her & she becomes so silly when playing with these.
customer_reviews.author: Nadja Ravenstar

customer_reviews.title: Atrocious packaging!
customer_reviews.text: Watch out for the packaging! These come attached to a piece of cardboard using those little plastic bits with a "T" on each end similar to what you find with tags attached to clothing or socks held together, only smaller. It's very important to make sure you get these completely removed from the toy or your cat may swallow or choke on them. They really need to package these differently. Other than that, my cat likes them.
customer_reviews.author: Stevewf1

customer_reviews.title: Favorite, even better than shoelaces.
customer_reviews.text: For some of us, billionaires and felines, all the world is a plaything. Among the felines though, this is one of their favorites. I don't know enough billionaires to form an accurate measurement of how many enjoy catnip mice toys, so I don't know the statistical significance. But among cats, at least (r+1) 6 stars, maybe more. I don't need to check the math. I've been through a ton. I suppose the catnip gets stale, but you can rub some fresh on the outside. They are durable. They don't end up in the trash from being disassembled the first day but rather from being around long enough to require replacement.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Do you know why cat toys don't come with instructions?
customer_reviews.text: Because cats don't need instructions. That's a human thing, apparently. All I have to do is drop one of these on the floor and my cat comes running; he's enamored for hours. Really, it's a win-win situation: my cat gets to do strange stuff with his catnip for an underterminable length of time (hey, we've all been there) and I get to play video games without a cat sitting in front of my television screen RIGHT DURING THE BOSS FIGHT.
customer_reviews.author: ★AM1 Engineer★

customer_reviews.title: Item received, not pictured
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, received something other than what’s shown in the photos. I wanted a feathered toy, and all the photos shown had toys with feathers on them, so I was good to go with any of them pictured. No feathers on the one I received and my pet showed no interest whatsoever. Amazon was great for refunding me though. Now off to search for another feathered toy.
customer_reviews.author: DR Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Best mice around!
customer_reviews.text: These are my cat’s favorite toys, beating out even some fancy-smancy electric ones. He loves to bat, chase, bite, and carry the little mice around. He will play 20-30 minutes independently with them, as long as he doesn’t lose it under the furniture. On the first one I gave him the stitching along the bottom eventually frayed, but he was playing with it very hard and even biting/pulling the stitches out, so I wasn’t surprised. I stitched it back shut and haven’t had any more problems with over a week of play. It has even survived a few dunks in his water bowl. Unfortunately they are easily lost, but I will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Megan K.

customer_reviews.title: A big hit!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has a little box of toys and she will go drag out what she wants to play with and typically leave it in that room. This is the first toy she has brought upstairs into the bedroom. I don't know if the novelty will wear off with the catnip lifespan but they are cheap enough to keep repurchasing. She is currently in her tent attacking her new favorite mousey.
customer_reviews.author: Heli

customer_reviews.title: Cat LOVES them
customer_reviews.text: I dunno what kind of catnip is in these things but my cat adores them. He is old and has health issues so he's not a hugely active cat but he's bapped these around quite a few times. But really, he just loves to have them near him. He'll put both paws on them, hold them down and sniff and rub his face all over them. He likes it when we squish them and make the crinkle sound and then give them to him. And likes having one in his bed. I didn't necessarily buy them to calm him, but they seem to. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lachesisx

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful catnip fish - cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Catnip crinkle fish that my kitten loves to bat around with his paws and carry it in his mouth. He absolutely loves these fish and the SmartyKat catnip mice. I highly recommend these and the SmartyKat mice for your cat or kitten. Cats need to pounce and hunt and “kill” pray to satisfy their God-given instincts! These toys are wonderful for allowing them to do just that.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Bezz

customer_reviews.title: Not that she actually needs catnip.......
customer_reviews.text: but as long as she is one of the kitties for whom catnip works, then why not let her get a recreational buzz on once in a while? She gets her glassy-eyed glow on, then proceeds to harangue our Golden Retriever who absolutely adores his kitty. We can really tell a difference between her catnip high and her natural wall-bouncing high. I wish it worked for me!
customer_reviews.author: alfisch

customer_reviews.title: Plush Mice Cat Toys Super Cute Catnip Fun
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I saw these I love them for their size and cuteness, and so did my cat! Naturally, the catnip attracted her and she went a little crazy that first day. However, the scent doesn't really linger for her and interest has mostly waned. Still, they are the perfect size for her and she checks in on them every so often (without getting very excited). I think I'll try soaking them in a vat of catnip soaked in water, let them dry and see how that works.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves the catnip in these!!
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t the flashiest mouse cat toys available, but my Maggie absolutely goes crazy for them when I initially buy or give them to her because she loves the catnip in them! Even for an older cat she will play with these for a good few weeks or more before leaving them alone. Believe they can get a bit stale and used feeling after awhile, so it’s good to replace them I’ve found and my cat approves, and though that may seem like a pain these are so cheap buying a few of these a year doesn’t end up being that big of a deal to make your fur baby happy!
customer_reviews.author: skellimae

customer_reviews.title: So fun and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: My 4 cats love these "mouse toys." I have purchased many of these. Anywhere I see them, I buy all of the ones on display. and have ordered online. Bubba James loses interest in the mice if I remove them from the display card. So, there are several lying around the house with all 3 mice still attached to the display card. He just finds it more of a challenge dealing with 3 mice at a time....macho guy that he is! With four cats actively playing with these, they get a real workout. Occasionally one will get ripped open, but only after it has seen many hours of playtime (or harrassment, whatever your point of view).
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Small Town Man Becomes Confused With Cat Nip Toy!
customer_reviews.text: The idea was sound....make a nice catnip toy...they did that...BUT..what they did NOT do...is think about the customer...as in...NO INSTRUCTIONS!! NOWHERE on the card....So..What If You are new cat owner? It took me a while to figure out WHERE to put the catnip...oy! and the Catnip is kinda sealed in the toy!! the Cats were bummed..I was bummed...I'll look elsewhere from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Sedgewick Collins

customer_reviews.title: Not terrible for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the cats for Christmas. They loved it! Smelled super strong so they could smell it through the Christmas wrapping paper and knew it was for them. It's not super durable though, after 30 minutes of play the mouse was SOAKED, and parts of it were chewed off. They are cheap so I guess you can keep buying them, but would have liked them to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Cassle

customer_reviews.title: Our cats preferred fuzzy mice
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 different types of fuzzy mice for my newly adopted kitties. SmartKitty catnip mice are the ones they prefer. I read other reviews saying that catnip mice are carried off to various locations, so I opted not to give them all 3 at the same time. The card with 2 of them remained in the shipping box. I caught one kitty pulling out the card with the remaining 2 mice and started playing with it. They toss the mouse and chase, pounce on it, and rub on it. The ones from the grocery store get an occasional pounce but are quickly abandoned. I will be ordering more some time in the next few months.
customer_reviews.author: craft4u

customer_reviews.title: My cat actually likes these - and she hates EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't like anything. She doesn't like other animals, other people, and she definitely doesn't like toys. Wave a streamer in front of her? Meh. Shine a laser on the floor? Meh. Crinkly balls? Jingly balls? Birds on a strings? Meh. Meh. Meh. So I was completely amazed when I got her these and...she likes them! She'll actually play with these for a few minutes before going back to not caring about you or anything else. They're a great price, too! Gotta go, the cat just threw up on the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: TerpDX

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats LOVE these toys! They throw them in the air and catch them! I have never seen them take to another toy as much as they have to these! My cats as not too young anymore (14 and 10) but they look like little energetic kittens with these toys for sure! My one cat did chew the tail off of one but the tail is just a string so totally expected. But the body of the cat is super durable and the cat nip smell is still strong after 3 months where they still love to play with them! Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Loveit

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Toy
customer_reviews.text: These are my cats' favorite toys by far. I like them because it keeps them busy and as long as they have these mice to play with, they stop stealing small objects from me (pens, barrettes, etc.). Another great thing about these mice is that they are silent unlike some other cat toys with crackly plastic or little bells inside. I like to keep extras on hand because they do get lost around the house and after awhile they do rip and fall apart. My kitties have also recently developed a habit of depositing these mice in their water dish...so it's nice to have extras while the water-logged ones are drying out.
customer_reviews.author: k.e.78

customer_reviews.title: Super fun for my cat
customer_reviews.text: This is my cat's favorite toy now. It is holding up really well considering the amount of time he spends trying to murder it. Came with a decent amount of catnip, and easy to empty and refill. Velcro closure is nice and sturdy, haven't had any issues with it falling open by accident despite the toy being tossed in the air and kicked vigorously by my cat. I'll probably by another just so I don't have to spend half an hour hunting this one down when he loses it under furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G

customer_reviews.title: Ivy Kitty Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly and without damage. I filled the little compartment with the provided catnip; only takes a very small amount. I called Ivy and showed her the toy, wiggling it around. Her eyes lit up and she sniffed the air; she could already smell the fresh catnip. I threw it down in front of her and she immediately went for it, playing with it for several minutes. She comes back to it several times a day and plays with it, batting it, holding it and kicking it with her rear feet. She Loves It! Catnip toys are her weakness :)
customer_reviews.author: birdie59

customer_reviews.title: Safe, Inexpensive Fun For Your Kitty!
customer_reviews.text: These little mice are great toys for cats who love cat nip. They are inexpensive and stimulating for your kitty. Be sure to remove any stickers on the mice. Each mouse has a plastic tab on the nose and rear that secures it to the cardboard for shipping. Those need to be cut off (both ends of the plastic) on each end of the mouse so your cat doesn't chew them off & swallow them. This is approximately the sixth time I've bought these. They are so inexpensive that when the catnip wears off, I just buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Karen

customer_reviews.title: Instant bliss! Best toy ever.
customer_reviews.text: Like seriously, soon as my cat got a hold of this little mouse, she went crazy. Has been playing with it since like a week straight. They are really small so I'm down to 1 from the original 3. I'm sure they're under one of our sofas somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Marroquin

customer_reviews.title: Best mice for cats
customer_reviews.text: We have tried so many mice over the years and hands down, these are the best. They're even more interesting to the cat if you un-knot the tail and separate it so it forks. Two tails are better than one! The best part about these mice is that they're packed pretty tightly with stuffing, so they bounce a little when the cats play with them - they don't just sit there. Both of our cats go crazy over these mice (even long after the catnip has worn off) while the other styles of mice just sit there...unloved. Price is great, too.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Cats found their Christmas present...
customer_reviews.text: So I got these to put in my cats' stockings. Yes, I'm one of those people. Anyway, I put them in a box until I was able to get them to the stockings. Well, they must smell REALLY good, because my cats found them, somehow got the box open, stole the mice, and played with them all day! I found them when I got home from work, put them in a different container, and thought they'd be safe. I was wrong. They got them out overnight and had a party! So needless to say, they must be great because they are Romanoff, Drax, and Sailor approved!
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: New life in a lazy cat
customer_reviews.text: I have a pregnant cat who is just so lazy, we shes always been lazy, so I bought these mice in the hopes of getting her to play more. And boy did they do just that. I put one in front of her while she was napping and she instanyl woke and started rubbing her face on the mouse. within 5 minutes she was playing, rolling and batting the mouse around. It is very sturdy, as she went crazy playing with it. To me it has no smell but to her it has a lot. still a week later and she is still playing with it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiFar83

customer_reviews.title: just buy em!
customer_reviews.text: i got my kitten when she was 8weeks old and as a new cat mama made sure there were plenty of toys for her when she came to her forever home. out of all the toys i purchased from amazon- jingley ones, feathery ones, rolly ones, crinkly ones, scratchy ones- these mice are her absolute favorite. and the price! they’ve held up great to her clawing and biting but if they ever tear i’d buy her more without hesitation. she keeps herself so busy with these (see video). the amount of dedication she has to hunting these mice rivals that of hunting the laser pointer, and you know that’s saying something!
customer_reviews.author: Madi Grigsby

customer_reviews.title: Hide & Seek
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 7 years old and she has never been very playful. I have wasted money on toys she just looks at with disdain. The three catnip mice were very reasonable and I decided to try one more time. Well, she really likes them and scoots them all over the house. Only problem is that accidentally (or on purpose) she hides them and I have to find them and scoop them out from under and behind things. Of the six (2 pkgs) I have bought her, she has managed to hide four mice so my hunt goes on. Now we have a play toy for both of us!
customer_reviews.author: CBG

customer_reviews.title: My cat enjoys them
customer_reviews.text: Neat little package, they are made with thick felt materials. He plays with it for hours on the first day. My son throws them and he will go fetch. It might be the catnip that attracted him but he enjoys carrying them in his mouth around the house and hunting them down. Personally I think they are very cute and my son loves the astronaut kitty. Bought these because our son is very into outer space and loves our cat.
customer_reviews.author: THOMPSONS

customer_reviews.title: Price is right and cats love them.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these! They are soft and don’t rip apart easily because they are made from cloth. Their tails are made from twin. The first pack I bought was over a year ago and while my cats still play with them, several have lot the cat nip aroma. I bought a new pack today and gave my female cat one (who is almost 9 years old) and she was flipping it all over the place like she was a kitten. I will continue to buy these as long as the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSkyDay

customer_reviews.title: Great On The Outside. Inside? Not So Much...
customer_reviews.text: The cats loved these at first. Perhaps too much. They soon eviscerated the mice, whose plastic guts spilled out. I don't think the cats ate any of the plastic, but I wasn't going to take a chance, so the remains of these mice soon found themselves in the trash. I'll seek out 100% all-natural mice from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin Vato

customer_reviews.title: Fussy Cat Loves These
customer_reviews.text: We have had our feral for 10 years now. Malnourished before rescue she is very small. She is tiny, and very fussy about everything. She loves these mice. Just ordered another set. They are small and perfect for her. She doesn't try to claw them apart. She just goes through the killing motions with her back paws and then licks and licks. Her teeth and claws are not big enough to do damage to her toys. She just ignores them. Not these and I'm happy to have found something that she really likes.
customer_reviews.author: ibanamazonfan

customer_reviews.title: My cat goes crazy for these!
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a 3 year-old tuxedo cat who'd lived her whole life in a group shelter. Not having any toys of her very own to play with, it became clear she loves little toys she can bat (and carry) around by herself. She spends hours playing with these little mice and I find them all over the house. As I do with all of her toys, I cut the tags off and round off the corners (leaving about 1/4") so tags don't get in the way of the toy itself. These little mice are a great value, very well made and there's nothing that can hurt her. Paws up!
customer_reviews.author: Mallomar

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: A few end up under the couch, a few magically disappear, but each one is loved by the resident furball. I had to pitch these favorites when she got fleas, but one made it into the wash. I was stunned when it came out in one piece, even after drying. She has that one “baby” left and I’m hoping more quickly arrive. These are her favorites, by far! The picture is of the lone survivor next to a quarter for scale.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: As close to real as my cats can have lol
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and they love batting these little faux mice around. Helps keep them active. Yes, they tire of them eventually. So I pick them up and stick them in a bag in drawer for a while. Then when I get them back out they are like a new thing all over again. Keeping them in a zip loc baggie must make the catnip scent strong again. They last as long as they possible can being exposed to sharp claws and teeth. I'd but them again and again. They are cheap entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Barb H

customer_reviews.title: My Siamese cats favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Siamese cats and 1 of them treats these stuffed mice like they are real, She's the best mouse flinger I've ever seen, if it were real it would have died of a heart attack flying through mid-air!! And when she's finished she drowns it in her water dish, They have a lot of toys, But this is the favorite of all, I have "lost" at least 30 + mice somewhere in the house, never to be seen again?? I highly recommend them, they are real mouse size and certainly go through a lot with my Siamese fur-babies(she's got one right now so I'll see how long it takes before she drowns it)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Belle

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: Eight months and my cat still plays with these in fact the reason I'm writing this review is I just got done playing fetch with her. She rarely plays with any other toy but these she'll carry around in her mouth, swat, chase after and just go crazy with them. I have a cat tree and she loves when I throw one on top for her to chase after. I don't know if they use chemicals, I hope not but it's well worth the $2.
customer_reviews.author: Will.who

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love These!
customer_reviews.text: I have to purchase these on a regular basis because my cats love them so much. The only thing they love more than playing with them is hiding them. Eventually, I find them under radiator covers, the refrigerator, a throw pillow, etc. These mice are a great value because my cats get so much pleasure out of each one.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: These mice are addicting for all ages of cats. I currently have four cats, and each of them love these mice. I order in bulk and give to friends as gifts for their pets and even get extra for my own. They are filled with catnip, but none of my cats get over-excited from this, just enough to play with the toy pretty intensely. They are small and easy to toss around, so they will often get lost under furniture. This is not a problem for me as I clean house often and find them everywhere. Buyers Beware: Your cat will be thankful for their new toys when you bring these mice home!
customer_reviews.author: Whittybitty247

customer_reviews.title: The tails are not attached well at all, and can be ingested.
customer_reviews.text: On the second day of having these, my cat, unbeknownst to me, had been able to pull the tail out or it came loose, swallowed it and threw it up overnight Thursday, for me to find Friday morning. I'm thankful he did throw it up but I also had no idea these were not durable in the slightest! I promptly threw the other 2 in the trash and would not recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Tesca

customer_reviews.title: Nymeria approves
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loved these when they first arrived, but she's a diva and loses interest in everything. One of the mouse's came already opened underneath slightly and she tore into it pretty quickly, even though it had all the stuffing half coming out, it's her favourite one to play with, she plays with all of them still occasionally, but she will play with the destroyed one the most for so much longer than the rest. They definitely have catnip inside, but she isn't very interested in catnip so I don't think that's what keeps her interested in these. I'll most likely repurchase them whenever she runs out!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Cute critters disappear almost as quickly as live ones
customer_reviews.text: Packaging terrible. A problem with Amazon. Plastic glued to paper so that neither is recycleable. Dont know about durability, since I got them an hour ago, but my young cat went absolutely insane over them. But I am going to have to think of something to keep them from disappearing under furniture after 5 minutes, which really made him crazy! Will post solution if I can find one. Or maybe someone has already, I will check!
customer_reviews.author: C. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Penelope approves!
customer_reviews.text: My very playful kitty Penelope loves her mice toys, and this one made her all crazy like. She reacted to this mouse stuffed with catnip like a little kitten again. It was so entertaining watching flip out over the mouse, until she started to shred it into pieces. So far it's held up very well, not sure how long it's going to last with how aggressive she's been tearing at it to get to the catnip. It's well made and very cool how you put the catnip into it. Great toy for her.
customer_reviews.author: calcrnflakegirl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little mice!
customer_reviews.text: My cat love these. He was nuts for them. I use a string and tie it around the tail and then hang them from like a chair or some thing and he hides under the chair and swats the mouse and goes nuts. It’s great. I would buy more. But they all end up under the couch, and it’s a pain in the ass to pull them from under the couch. Right now I have about 15 cat toys under my couch. Anyone want to come over and retrieve them?
customer_reviews.author: Chispi

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Purrington loves them--only one small problem
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves these mice. They are cute, fun, and the perfect size for him to carry around in his mouth & play fetch with. And he hasn't been able to pull off any of their tails! The only thing I don't like about them is the seams along the underside are poorly sewn and eventually start to pop open. It only takes about five minutes to sew them back up, but it's enough to knock them down one star.
customer_reviews.author: Slerrrrrp

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves them
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these little fellows. They are very tiny though and we have one totally lost in the house somewhere. I bought two packs of them. I gave her one pack and put the other pack on the desk. She got it from the desk and plays with the ones still attached to the packaging more than the ones I opened 😂 I am going to leave them attached I'm sure eventually she'll tear them off of it , seems like her goal 😂
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Lee

customer_reviews.title: Owner of 22 cats.
customer_reviews.text: My cats went absolutely bonkers over these. They were attacking them while I was trying to cut them off the card. I've never seen them act like that over anything before. But after about an hour they all lost interest. Whatever is in them or on them seems to loose it's potency pretty quick. They are reasonably priced so I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: First I would like to say my cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: First I would like to say my cat loves it, but that's to be expected since she loves catnip and that is what you put in the toy.in the photo that they advertise, it looks like the mouse is velvety, but it actually is not. More like the body of the mouse is made of whatever material they use for toy troll dolls hair. This is easily ripped out when your cat plays with it so make sure they do not eat it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your cat will LOVE them!
customer_reviews.text: These are my cat's favorite toy! He's older and it can be hard to get him to play much, but when he comes across this laying on the floor he goes to town! He likes them so much that I gave two each to some friends of mine who have cats, and all of them seem to love them, too! Not only that, but they last forever. The only reason I end up needing to buy more is they mysteriously seem to disappear without a trace (common in our house) Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these!
customer_reviews.text: I have to have these on subscribe and save. My cat absolutely loves them...and keeps losing them. They are an affordable way to make sure he has something to play with all the time. I'm pretty sure the dogs eventually eat them...but I have no proof of that...simply the fact that they keep going missing. I have rearranged the entire house recently...so they weren't hidden in a corner.
customer_reviews.author: Freya

customer_reviews.title: My cat love this!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these cat nip tea bags!! He just can't get enough of them. They have a strong cat nip smell that he just can't resist!! Smartykat cat nip toys seem to be his favorite. He's only had one kind that he didn't care much for and it was some emoji ones that he ate the ribbon on and then he was don't with them. He really loves the cat nip tea bag and the cat nip mice though...those are his favorites!!
customer_reviews.author: E. Moore

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have about 15 of these laying all over the house. Probably more. One of our cats loves carrying them to the top of the stairs and throwing it down (or having us throw it down) then chases it down. She hides them all over and chirps to them, tosses them in the air, it’s a real show. Her brother enjoys bunny kicking them and they hold up well under this abuse. Hands down the best cat toy I’ve bought besides the laser.
customer_reviews.author: Dani P.

customer_reviews.title: Cat is obsessed
customer_reviews.text: My one cat Jack is obsessed with these. He plays with them until they disappear under the couch and even sleeps by them. He hunts them down like they are actual mice. He never meows but when he has a "mouse" he meows loudly throughout the house so we can hear him, and he loves to carry it over to us and drop it like he's brought us a present. I'm so glad this is the only type of present he's been able to get us.
customer_reviews.author: alegna222

customer_reviews.title: These are great, my youngest cat LOVES them
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased about 6 packs of these to date. My youngest cat absolutely loves them. He picks them up and carries them around the house. He loves to play soccer on the kitchen floor. It is his favorite toy! My other cat doesn't play with anything, lol. Every cat is different and likes different things. For the price, you can't go wrong. I keep buying more because I'm tired of going on "toy patrol" to find all the ones that are missing.
customer_reviews.author: YL

customer_reviews.title: Two paws up!
customer_reviews.text: These have become both of my cats’ favorite toys. They can pick them up and carry them around, bat them all over the house and occasionally leave one in the water bowl! They’ve also held up remarkably well when not drowned. I’ve had to fix a few ripped belly seams on the ones I cut the tags off of (easily resewn), but all ears and tails are still attached after six months. Easily worth the price for my two middle aged girls.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The only toy my cat will fetch reliably.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these so much I had to order 2 extra sets. Unfortunately her favorite game is to stuff them under the refrigerator. Other than that, she fetches them pretty reliably. She will self entertain with them, too. I tried sewing her some, but without the crinkly sound she isn't interested. She only wants these. We just say where's crinkle fish and she runs to it. Love these things for the hours of fun.
customer_reviews.author: saspinner

customer_reviews.title: It's fine
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly good as a ball, but I don't notice any special attraction to it even with catnip cats. I got it to put inside the Kong maze craze toys. I put treats in those for them to fish out, along with one of those toys with a motion-activated chirping sound. I thought this would add to the fun for them, but doesn't seem to make a difference. And yes I have cats that like catnip. Not all cats do, but I have some and it doesn't seem to matter with this.
customer_reviews.author: FJMShopper

customer_reviews.title: My older cat loves these.
customer_reviews.text: It's his first toy in years bc he never showed interest in those I bought when first getting him, but now, that he's older and not going out as he used to, I thought I'd try again. Glad I did bc he immediately loved them. He's gotten some good exercise in while playing with them and now... I feel guilty that I haven't bought him more toys over the years. He's got many more coming!
customer_reviews.author: A. Derifield

customer_reviews.title: Kitty nip toy for an anxious cat
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, Sunshine and Sneaky. Sneaky is around 8 months old now while Sunshine is 4 years old. Sneaky was not excited about the mice, only chewing on the tail but Sunshine loves them! And thats why I got them because Sunshine suffers through anxiety, this kept her busy and coming out from under the bed all day. Its definitely not durable for a kitten though, I don’t think Sneaky knows how to play with them correctly, the tail came undone in 10 minutes. And she lost interest afterwards unless I play with her. But Sunshine going nuts chasing and pounding this little thing. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vivianna Humara

customer_reviews.title: TL;DR buy these!!! My senior cat loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I adopted my senior cat about a month ago. I only got 2 toys at first because I wasn’t sure what she would like. Well the first two got all torn up so I ordered the 10 pack of these. I couldn’t even get them out of the packaging without her freaking out. The catnip is like crack. She seems so happy and excited. I’m glad I got 10 bc the first one is already torn up (she plays so rough I have scars to prove it). Definitely worth the $8. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: My Kitty LOVES these
customer_reviews.text: These mice are my kitty's favorite toy. He will play for hours and hours and never lose interest. Really keeps him occupied and develop his "hunting" skills. My only concern is that they keep getting lost under furniture, tables and kitchen appliances. There are plenty of these mice hidden all over the house. I now keep lots of these mice on hand for when the kitty loses the one he is playing with. Thank goodness they are very cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Luca

customer_reviews.title: my cat approves
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like about the mice was the way they were fastened to the cardboard. It was very hard to make sure all the little pieces of the tie wraps were out of the mice. It took a few minutes for my cat to decide the mice were approved, but now each morning I have to search for them under the furniture and in corners. He obviously plays with them at night (and in the early morning when he wants me to wake up).
customer_reviews.author: Josie P. Little

customer_reviews.title: The cats are going nuts
customer_reviews.text: Our cats are going nuts over these little mice. I threw down three of them and they havent stopped playing with them. They roll all over them, bat them around, and "hide" and pounce on them quite a bit. One of the cats has claimed one of the lighter colored mice as his own, he carries it around in his mouth, sleeps with it, and attacks it regularly. Its so cute. A great amount of stimulation and activity for your cats at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Loman

customer_reviews.title: Kit kit loves them.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these! She rarely responds to catnip but boy did she go wild for these. I had to sew one up already because she was intent on murdering it. But that is the joy of these small felted mousies, she can seek and destroy as part of her training for world domination.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charming loves the hunt!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these. Charming, my only male, spends hours hiding them and then looking for them. This is a new game he invented and it’s all for the love of these mice. He’s so proud when he finds them, he’ll walk around with one in his mouth, meowing loud, so everyone knows he has found one. Also...my large mix breed pittbull will hide one to nap with it in her mouth...it’s weird. We don’t allow it...but she’s determined to find one.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Pavwoski

customer_reviews.title: Buy multiple packs!
customer_reviews.text: Your cat will love these mice. Our cat worked so hard to try to dig these mice out of her Christmas bag because she wanted them so badly. Once your cat gets the mice, they will probably go crazy because of the catnip. Ours did and it was hilarious to watch, The best advice I can give to anyone looking at these is to buy multiple packs, because they're a bit small and easy to lose.. really great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

product_meta.title: SmartyKat Catnip Cat Toys
product_meta.description: Style:Skitter Critters™ Value Pack 10 count Catnip Cat ToysWORLDWISE-SmartyKat: Skitter critters Catnip Mice. These are tantalizing toys for cats! This package contains three 4 inch long mice that are packed with catnip. SmartyKat products are principally made from recycled, reclaimed, renewable and certified organic materials. Imported.
feature_bullets: Jumbo pack of ten adorable mice spiked with pure and potent catnip, perfect for catnip-loving cats and multi-cat households
Perfectly sized to bat and carry
Catnip causes a burst of energetic activity in cats followed by a mellow period
Pure & potent catnip is produced without chemicals or pesticides

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
